For example ctrl + s just focuses the save buttons (alternates between them) in Firefox when creating a new page in Confluence.

See attached image to see what is meant.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17323].
  {panel}

There's discussion of this at CONF-17005.  There have been some complaints about the reported supported level of core macros that aren't also "system" plugins.  The solution to this isn't clear.

One possibility is that the plugin manager page should not depend on the plugin's isSystem flag to decide whether or not to show it.

It seems that the plugin manager page will only show plugins that are not explicitly marked as system plugins. That means, any plugins that are marked as a system plugin (the {{system}} attribute in {{atlassian-plugin.xml}}) will not show there. When that happens, the plugin cannot be disabled/enabled by Confluence admins.

I think that logic is fine, but it might be semantically wrong for plugins that are _not_ marked as system plugins but sit in the application class path. One such plugin would be the Profile Macros. It was intentionally marked as a non-system plugin because users want to be able to enable/disable it.

Also, this raises a few questions:

* If a plugin that sits in the application class path is not a system plugin, what type of plugin is it? Note: Plugins in the application class path cannot be upgraded or downgraded.
* Can system plugins be enabled/disabled?
* How should Confluence differentiate system plugins that can be enabled/disabled from those that can't be?

See also discussion in CONF-17005.
fields.summary: Plugin repository shows non-system core plugins as "Unknown" and "Unsupported"  although they are supported by atlassian

fields.description:
If the name of the page contains the double quotes character ("), the "Edit in word" action from the "Tools" combo box fails to open Word.
Actually, the standard dialog box with the
"The following location is going to be opened on your computer... By the program: C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\OFFICE11\WINWORD.EXE..."
warning message is not displayed.
Instead, the browser forwards to my Confluence site home page.

One more information: this issue does not happen if the page name contains simple quotes (').

Cf https://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/WORDDV-263

fields.description:
Our old themes get more and more out of synch with our new features and with our quality standards. They are also impossible to document properly, all our docs are based on the standard theme. We will write new themes (or rewrite the existing ones from scratch) once Ben is on board and up to speed, but for now, we should start discouraging new users from using the old leftnav and clickr themes, while keeping the functionality available for all existing customers who are happy with the themes.

The main lever is changing the descriptions. Right now, the Default theme sounds very dull, while the other themes sound exciting. This is exactly the opposite of what we want to achieve.


My proposal (feel free to make it better!)


Default Theme
This is the default Confluence look and feel. We recommend this theme for evaluating Confluence and for most usecases, since all the documentation is based on this theme. You can customise colour-schemes and layouts manually, and you can apply CSS based changes to it easily too.


////

Classic Left Navigation Theme
This theme provides a navigation bar on the left hand side of the screen. It is based on the classic Confluence theme, and therefore lacks some of the UI polish and features of the Default Confluence theme.

Classic Clickr Theme
A theme without menus and lots of whitespace on the left and right border. It is based on the classic Confluence theme, and therefore lacks some of the UI polish and features of the Default Confluence theme.
fields.summary: Reword theme descriptions

fields.description:
Add the ability to: 

# drag and drop a file onto the rich text editor 
# drag and drop multiple files straight onto any Confluence page
fields.summary: Allowing drag and drop attachments onto Confluence and its editor

fields.description:
The Search and Browse tabs both allow the user to select the space with a  dropdown.

In the Known Location tab, the user must use a quick nav style space picker.

This is inconsistent with the other tabs, and could be annoying if a user needs to do it often.  Also, generally when using a page quick nav picker, it returns matches from all spaces. Why is this dialog different?

It would be better to provide a dropdown, which defaults to 'All Spaces', and allows the user to narrow the search to a specific one.
fields.summary: Page Move dialog - the Known Location tab has an inconsistent way of selecting a space

fields.description:
Edit a page in a space using the left nav theme, and edit the location.

The fields on the page move dialog do not fit properly - see screenshot.
fields.summary: Page Move dialog breadcrumbs have inconsistent styling in Left Nav theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17302].
  {panel}

If email addresses are hidden (site config) just don't show them, there's no need to show 'hidden'.

For example, in the attached screenie a new user might think that the _user_ is hidden.

!hidden-1.png!

It would be better to just not output anything to avoid such confusion.
fields.summary: Don't show 'hidden' for hidden email addresses - it's confusing
Support Utility Improvements

fields.description:
Need to add a feature to allow users to create a support zip via the admin console that will zip up logs and configuration files and do anything else that confluence support would need in order to reduce the number of bounces back and forth for requesting information. 

Also this will make it easier for triage engineers as it gives them an easy set of instructions to give the customer.
fields.summary: Enable zipping logs and configuration files for support requests

fields.description:
Hi Support,

saving this WikiMarkUp in Confluence:

{code}
# Text 1
\\
\\
# Text2
\\
\\
| Hallo | Test |
| Test | Test |
\\
\\
# Text3
{code}

will genereate the following site:

# Text 1
\\
\\
# Text2
\\
\\
| Hallo | Test |
| Test | Test |
\\
\\
# Text3

After editing the page without changing the wiki-markup the TinyMCE will change the wiki-markup to:

{code}
# Text 1
\\
\\
# Text2
\\
\\ | Hallo | Test |
| Test | Test |
\\
\\
# Text3
{code}

and the page looks like this:

# Text 1
\\
\\
# Text2
\\
\\ | Hallo | Test |
| Test | Test |
\\
\\
# Text3

This is getting worse when you open and save the page again. The confluence site is unusable.


Can you confirm this?

Greetz,
Fabian
fields.summary: Automated escaping of TinyMCE destroys Table
Create news with specific label

fields.description:
In IE, links are preceded with '^', when added without an alias, in rich-text mode.

Steps to replicate:
1) Using the "Insert/Edit Link" icon from rich-text mode, open the "Insert Link" popup
2) Choose the attachment from the "Attachments" tab
3) Do not specify an "Alias"
4) Click "OK"

Notice that the attachment link is created with a '^' preceding the name. The link is still valid and the attachment can be accessed/opened when clicked.

Problem is not experienced when an alias is specified. Only happens in IE. Replicated on IE7.
fields.summary: Link attachment without an alias, adds ^ in the link when using IE7

fields.description:
Some grids can be so large they result in OOMs with stacktraces like these: 


javax.servlet.ServletException: Servlet execution threw an exception
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:313)

caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
    at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.html.util.CharArray.grow(CharArray.java:267)


An approach to deal with this could be to have limits on how many cells we are prepared to deal with per file. This is a rare case at the moment, it only seems to occur on degenerate files, so it is for now classified as minor bug.
fields.summary: Previewing Excel files with thousands of rows and/or columns can result in OutOfMemoryError

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# Enter the following content onto a page:
{noformat}
line 1

line 2{noformat}
# Watch the page.
# Edit the content and remove 'line 2'.


The notification email will show 'Changes (0)'

The diff is shown correctly when viewed within Confluence.

This bug means that large amounts of content could be removed from a page, and the watchers would not be informed of those changes.
fields.summary: Emails from a watched page do not show diff content when entire paragraphs are removed

fields.description:
h5. Bug Background

# When using \{viewfile}, \{viewpdf} or \{viewppt}, if the file names contains umlaut character, user will not be able to download the attachment. [Screenshot|^testviewfileumlaut.png] of \{viewfile} attached
# Instead the user will see Page Not found page. [Screenshot|^PageNotFound.png] attached
# However, when downloading the files from the [attachment page|^AttachmentPage.png], user is able to download. The URL for this when you open the link in a new tab/window is as follows:
{code}
http://localhost:8080/download/attachments/2424835/%C3%A4%C3%B6%C3%BC%C3%84%C3%96%C3%9C.ppt
{code}
On the other hand, for the {viewfile}, you get the following URL:
{code}
http://localhost:8080/download/attachments/2424835/%E4%F6%FC%C4%D6%DC.ppt
{code}

h5. Special findings

h5. Sample Files
# [^äöüÄÖÜ.pdf]
# [^äöüÄÖÜ.ppt]
fields.summary: Unable to download PDF or PPT files that has umlaut character in the filename when using {viewfile} macro

fields.description:
Hi,

we have a user "gweiß" in the Active Directory and a user "gweiss" in the local confluence database. It seems that the AD-user overrides the local user. It doesn't matter if we try to login as "gweiss" or "gweiß" - in both cases only the password of the AD-user "gweiß" will be accepted and in both cases the AD-user "gweiß" will be logged in. 

In user administration, a click on "gweiß" correctly shows the user details of "gweiß", but also a click on the user "gweiss" shows the user details of "gweiß". Although the URL says "/admin/users/viewuser.action?username=gweiss", the displayed user is "gweiß".

Next strange thing: as user "gweiß", you can't edit your personal profile. The shown profile is correct, but there is no edit link and no "labels", "watches", "drafts" and "settings" tab. Instead, you can follow yourself.

The users "gweiß" and "gweiss" have the same Full Name and the same e-mail address (the e-mail address only differs in upper/lower case: "Gweiss@xy.com" and "gweiss@xy.com")

Perhaps you can tell me what's wrong - we will try to rename the user "gweiss" in the local database and hope, that this will allow the AD-user to edit his user profile.

Best regards,
Sebastian Höhne
fields.summary: LDAP user with german umlauts overrides local user

fields.description:
Dragging and dropping multiple files onto the attachments page will upload two files at a time.

Instead, it should respect the General Configuration setting - 'Maximum Attachments per Upload'
fields.summary: Drag & Drop upload does not respect the 'Maximum Attachments per Upload' config setting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17278].
  {panel}

This has been derived from [CONF-4955|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4955].
The above seems to have been fixed for registered {{groups}} only, not individual users who do not belong to any groups in Confluence, but have "Can Use" permission.
If a user is a member of a specific group, the anonymous permissions are being inherited correctly for viewing the space, search, dashboard, etc, but removing the user from all groups and assigning individual global "Can Use" permission, does not show content for the following:

    * the space's content in a global search
    * the space's content in a recently-updated macro, content-by-label macro or any other macro that is based on the search index.
fields.summary: Confluence users should inherit permissions from the anonymous user

fields.description:
Since version 2.8 of the Left Navigation theme, the theme now displays the logo for the page (the space logo for spaces or the user profile image for a user's home).  See attached screenshots for examples.

The issue seems to be in this file:
{{confluence-leftnavigation-theme-2.8.jar/templates/leftnavigation/main.vmd}}

The old main.vmd wrapped the code for showing the logo in the heading/pagetitle with "{{#if(!$showNavigation)}}".  The new code no longer does this, and so it always shows the logo.

This is the relevant section in main.vmd for version 2.8 of the theme (lines 74-79):
{noformat}
#if ($sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.username"))
    #set ($tildeUsername = "~$username")
    #logoBlock($tildeUsername)
#else
    #logoBlock($spaceKey)
#end
{noformat}

I inserted some code before and after, and now it looks like this (now lines 74-81):
{noformat}
#if (!$showNavigation) 
    #if ($sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.username"))
        #set ($tildeUsername = "~$username")
        #logoBlock($tildeUsername)
    #else
        #logoBlock($spaceKey)
    #end
#end
{noformat}

That seemed to fix the problem for us.
fields.summary: Space logo/profile image appears twice in Left Navigation theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17274].
  {panel}

We've recently upgraded Confluence from 2.5.1 to 3.0.2. One of my users has complained that they cannot quickly review the Dashboard's Recently Updated list for interesting changes, as the list no longer includes the Space that the updated content is in. Seems this is because the recently-updated-dashboard macro does not have a "showSpace" option, or similar.

This is a minor problem easily worked around, but would be nice to have added anyway.

h3. Workaround

The dashboard recent updates macro has a mode where profile pictures are not displayed that also happens to display the space names when the macro is not used inside a space.

* Go to the Confluence Administration > Look and Feel > Layouts page
* Create a custom "Global Layout"
* Remove the "showProfilePic=true" macro parameter from the recently-updated-dashboard macro
fields.summary: Recently-updated-dashboard macro should have an option to include the space name in the output

fields.description:
The Confluence Wiki markup editor grabs focus from the IE8 Find in this page toolbar after it highlights matching text, resulting in the user overwriting their content if they keep typing.

To reproduce:
# Edit a page
# Go into Wiki Markup mode if not already
# Add content, e.g. "Hello World"
# Hit CTRL+F to bring up IE's Find toolbar
# Start typing "Hello". IE will match text and select it
# As you keep typing, the editor will grab focus back and you will start over-writing  your content
fields.summary: Markup editor doesn't work nicely with IE8's "Find In This Page" feature

fields.description:
I can't reproduce, but I got it the first time when going to this URL after Extranet was upgraded to m6:

https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/2009/10/20/Confluence+3.1-m6+Milestone+Notes?focusedCommentId=1778581512#comment-1778581512

The NullPointerException occurred in the Velocity rendering of the comments.vmd file. There was no line number.
fields.summary: NullPointerException when rendering comments on a page on EAC

fields.description:
On a clean setup of Confluence.

Use an external database and a user with no permissions to create the tables.
Confluence will run the SQL to create the tables which will fail, but setup will continue and fail later because the tables don't exist.  The real problem is that this error propagates back up to the user as a 500 page with unfriendly stack trace.

We should detect this case as it would be common, and produce a nicer error message.
fields.summary: Missleading error message when no permission to create tables
System Properties under Administration > Support Request is incorrect

fields.description:
"Embed multi-media content from other web sites into your Confluence page." Doesn't really inspire. The docs on CAC are better in that they mention many of the providers.

We should say something like 

"Embed multi-media content from other web sites into your Confluence page, for example content from YouTube, Twitter, SlideShare, Google Calendar and many more". 

This is becoming more important now that we add the widget connector to the insert menu.
fields.summary: Improve Widget connector macro description wording
Update list of dependencies on CAC

fields.description:
The printable view of a Confluence page, for example,
http://confluence.xyz.com/display/ABCD/Home?decorator=printable
does not display entire page nor scroll bar options in IE.  It seems fine in Firefox as the scroll bar appears there.  See attached screenshots.
fields.summary: No browser scroll bar in IE6/7 when using printable decorator

fields.description:
The 'Create Personal Space' link is missing when using the 'Left Navigation Theme'.
Steps to replicate:
1) Set global theme to 'Left Navigation Theme'
2) Log in as a user without personal space. Please ensure that this user does not have any permissions to the "Administration" section.
Notice that there is no 'Create Personal Space' link for this user.

For a user who has "Administration" permission, the "Create Personal Space" link is present under the "User Menu".

The workaround is to access the URL directly to create a personal space:
{quote}
http://<Confluence Base URL>/spaces/createpersonalspace.action
{quote}

Can be replicated on FireFox 3 and IE 7.
fields.summary: No 'Create Personal Space' link available in Left Navigation theme
ancestorIds:pageid makes no sense to users. We should use everyday english

fields.description:
This only affects IE6 and only when HTTPS is enabled. Also the missing images are not noticeable in the IE6 browser to the normal users. Other browsers like FF3, IE7 and Safari are not affected.

The images are from */images/shadow-light/* folder - they are missing because Confluence failed to add its context path to the relative URLs. ie. the correct url should be */contextPath/images/shadow-light/pictureName.png*

Other images in other folders are not affected.

Attached in this ticket are screenshots and Fiddler capture from IE6. 
Fiddler result from IE7 and FF3 are also included for comparison.
fields.summary: Missing images when accessing Confluence in https mode, IE6, and when using Context Path

fields.description: The text in the quick search drop-down is being shown as white on a white background and can only be read when I do a mouse-over. See the attached image.
fields.summary: Quick Search Text Invisible

fields.description:
The admin methods in {{FuncTestRpcHandlerImpl}} are meant to call {{assertCanAdminister}}.

It means that when we accidentally ship with this plugin installed we don't open up giant holes.  We should enforce this on every call to the handler.

This issue represents a task created from feedback on [CR-CONF-400|https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-CONF-400#c13718].
fields.summary: Wrap Func Test RPC Impl with a proxy to check for administrator access

fields.description: In Flash 10, fullscreen mode has limited support for keyboard input. Would be nice to detect flash player 10 and then allow users to press space and the arrow keys.
fields.summary: Viewfile macro slide viewer should support full screen keyboard interactivity available in Flash 10

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17254].
  {panel}

People really like that Confluence is a platform that is able to pull in data from various sources and allows you to display the data on pages in real-time.  We have a really good write up on what's possible:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Confluence+Reporting+HOWTO

However, the problem is that the majority of that relies heavily on unsupported plugins.  If/when things go wrong while using those macros, some customers would expect to receive support from Atlassian.  However, due to plugins like the [SQL Plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/SQL+Plugin] and the [Cache Plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Cache+Plugin] being unsupported, customers are asked to seek support from the plugin authors.

Developing a supported version of the SQL plugin would go a long way.
fields.summary: Officially support (or develop a new) SQL plugin

fields.description:
It will only display the Excel worksheet last saved and does not allow me to specify the sheet to display.  Changing parameters does not help.

xls is attached to the page and there isn't anything odd about it.

Screenshot 1 shows the wikimarkup where you can see that a different sheet has been entered.  Screenshot 2 shows the view of the page where the viewfile macro is showing a third worksheet in the excel file that was not even selected in either wiki markup....
fields.summary: ViewFile macro not displaying Excel sheets correctly in 3.1-m5-r7

fields.description:
From support request:

{quote}
We're testing the upgrade from our current Confluence 2.8.2 to 3.0.2.

We've run into an issue using the \{include\} and \{attachments\} macros.

We have a number of pages where we use the \{attachments\} macro to display a list of attachments on a page. Some of those pages are then included on other pages using \{include\}.

When we do this in 3.0.2, the main download links are OK, but the Edit, Remove, and View links result in errors. Looking at the links, it appears that they contain the wrong page ID.

In 2.8.2, the Edit and Remove links are OK (there's no View in 2.8.2).
{quote}

I'm able to replicate this in 3.0.2.
fields.summary: Broken links using {include} and {attachments} macros

fields.description:
Seeing security warning on Confluence pages when using IE6 and Confluence Advanced Macros 1.6.4 and HTTPS:
{quote}
This page contains both secure and nonsecure items. Do you want to display the nonsecure items?
{quote}

This happens in every pages (except for Confluence dashboard and admin pages).

A customer pinpointed the component that is breaking is the *fancybox web resources*; When this is disabled the affected page can be loaded in IE6 without the security warning, albeit with another warning that the web page contains problems that might prevent it from being displayed properly - this affects comment box in a page along with the gallery macro.

When testing in Confluence 3.0.2, the security warning is not reproducible the bundled Confluence Advanced Macros 1.6.2.10

This problem is specific to IE6.
fields.summary: Seeing security warning on Confluence pages when using ie6 and confluence advanced macros 1.6.4 and HTTPS
Add support for Microsoft Office on the Mac to Office Connector
Create a constraint in the EXTERNAL_ENTITIES table to prevent duplicate user name

fields.description:
The way dependencies from the confluence build to the bundled plugins cause problems in the source distribution.

We need to:
 * Change the bundled-plugins project to use the scope "runtime" (instead of "provided") for all the bundled plugins
 * Change the source distribution build to checkout and include the bundled plugins in the build
 * -Remove the dependency management in confluence-project fixing the confluence version-
 * Remove the exclusions on confluence in the bundled plugins
fields.summary: Bundled Plugin dependency model causing problems with source build

fields.description:
This was reported as fixed in CONF-8944 (Confuence 2.6) but I can still replicate it in Confluence 3.0.2 (also 2.9.1).

After integration with Crowd local user settings in OS_PROPERTYENTRY (identified by LOC_<username>) are not copied to reflect the migration to Crowd (should have EXT_<username> entry in this table).

This affects all profile settings eg. profile picture and site home page.

Note that the user attached profile picture will still be available in the selection of profile pictures, but not applied.

When logging into Confluence, Crowd users will need to update all their settings manually.
fields.summary: Profile settings are lost when using Crowd with Confluence 3.0.x

fields.description:
If you have a cache that is initially over 5000 elements in size, then resize it through the UI,
the maximumSize is correctly adjusted but the keyArray is NOT changed to reflect this (as it is in the constructor).

This means when the cache fills up, it will randomly break evict elements.

A workaround would be to restart to the server after updating the cache through the UI.
fields.summary: Resizing caches does not correctly update keyArray in EhCache's MemoryStore:keyArray

fields.description: I think this is the same as http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-13974, but wanted to be sure that this issue is not resolved in Confluence 3.0 and above. I'm not clear on the resolution and would appreciate some guidance.
fields.summary: Confluence does not display SWF files when using IE and FlashPlayer 10

fields.description:
We have tables where the content can often include the '|' character. No amount of quoting seems to make it possible to make the table work properly. See http://www.openehr.org/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=5997269 for an example.

The following should result in a two column table with first column containing 'parent node' followed by a bullet list of 2 members, and the 2nd column containing 'parent node' followed by a bullet list of one member.

|| The structural way || The terminology way ||
| parent node \\
* {color:#0000ff}site{color} = \|hand\|
* {color:#0000ff}laterality{color} = \|left\|
| parent node \\ 
* {color:#0000ff}site{color} = \|left hand\| |

I have to say, I like most things about Confluence, but I have come to absolutely detest the editor. For any kind of formal content that includes symbols, wiki markup just breaks instantly. I don't suppose it is going to change, but I would have to say that wiki markup is one of the worst technologies ever invented - no-one can remember how to edit it, it is not standardised anyway, and it breaks all the time.

Ok, having said that, I would be satisfied for this issue if only the quoting problem mentioned above could be fixed!
fields.summary: Quoting error in tables
Confluence should save the selection of an exported space for later re-use

fields.description:
The signup dialog has a message box at its top saying 

"Create an account to access Confluence. Already have an account? Log In."

If you have an account and click on the link, you can log in but you are redirected to the signup dialog again which doesn't make sense.

The user should be redirected to the Confluence home page instead.
fields.summary: "Log In" link in signup dialog does not work as expected

fields.description: I entered http://localhost:8080/signup.action right after installing Confluence 3.0.2 Std and logging out. The error message showed html code but did not render the link: This installation of Confluence is not set up to permit public signup. Please contact the site administrators for more information.
fields.summary: error msg contains html markup code after signup fails

fields.description:
We developed a confluence plugin with a theme. This theme overwrites the page.vmd.

If you view the history of a page, this theme is applied only partially. It seems that the correct themed page decorator is only used, when the theme is used as space-theme AND global theme.

How to reproduce:
- take a theme that overwrites the page.vmd
- assign this theme to a testing space and another theme as global theme (or just leave the default theme)
- create a page in the test space
- modify this page
- view the page's history
- click on the old version

Then you see the themed main.vmd in action (header, footer e.g.) but not the content, that was themed by the page.vmd

- assign the theme as global theme

Then the old version's view looks complete
fields.summary: Theme for older versions view works only if theme is used as space AND global theme.

fields.description:
When 2 dynamic lists are added to a confluence page. Only one works. 
The other is displayed but wont allow any additions to the tasklist.
fields.summary: Multiple dynamic tasklists in one page

fields.description:
Upload a set of large files using drag and drop.

While it is in progress, the user might want to cancel the uploads. Currently he must click on each icon for every file to cancel. Perhaps we should provide a 'Cancel All' button for this situation.

This may also be useful in the cases where something goes wrong with the uploads - the user would want to leave the screen, and may not know about the 'Escape' key shortcut.
fields.summary: Drag & Drop - a 'Cancel All' button may be useful on the upload dialog

fields.description:
The non-default themes should also allow drag and drop to be used.

The drop zone is not displayed on this feature either.
fields.summary: Drag & Drop does not work on Attachments page for Left Nav and Clickr themes

fields.description:
After attachments have been uploaded onto the Attachments page, the user must manually refresh to see those attachments.

This should happen automatically.
fields.summary: Drag & Drop plugin - attachments page should refresh after attachments have uploaded

Use IE8, add a new page, embed an image in the RTE.

Click on the image - an error is given:

{noformat}Webpage error details

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0)
Timestamp: Thu, 15 Oct 2009 03:40:42 UTC


Message: Object doesn't support this property or method
Line: 443
Char: 3
Code: 0
URI: https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/s/1711/45/3.1-m6-r3/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.confluence.tinymceplugin:editor-resources/com.atlassian.confluence.tinymceplugin:editor-resources.js?ieonly=true

{noformat}
fields.summary: Error is given on IE7 and 8 when clicking on an uploaded image
Add sorting options to the rss macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17232].
  {panel}

Upload an attachment using drag and drop.

While the upload is in progress, rename the folder containing the file.

The upload process dialog will simply freeze.

It would be much better if it could handle the error and inform the user what has occurred.
fields.summary: Drag & Drop plugin should be able to handle the removal of the source file

fields.description:
Following warning messages are logged into the log file, when the User and global language preference are set identical:
{quote}
2009-10-16 13:30:24,069 WARN [http-8080-2] [atlassian.confluence.languages.DefaultLanguageManager] getLanguage Unable to find configured language module: None
- referer: http://localhost:8080/users/editmysettings.action?atl_token=6ek-FREVaZ&edit=Edit | url: /users/doeditmysettings.action | userName: admin | action: doeditmysettings
{quote}

Steps to replicate:
1) Set both User and Global language to "English" - default.
2) Edit any value within user preferences for this user.

Editing user preferences will lodge the above warning into the log files.

The warning is *not* reported when the user and global language preferences *do not* match.
fields.summary: Language pack related warning messages in logs when editing user preferences
Drag and drop message is confusing when a user is restricted form uploading attachments in a space

fields.description:
Set space permissions so that a user cannot upload attachments.

As that user, use the drag and drop to try to upload an attachment.

Note that the attachment is uploaded, and only afterwards the user is informed that they cannot do it.

This makes no sense, as:
* the user must wait until the the file is uploaded before getting the feedback, which may take a while for a large upload
* if the user is trying to upload malware, then they may succeed despite the permission check

The permission check should be done first, and the upload refused if the user is restricted from uploading.
fields.summary: Drag and drop should do permission check before it uploads files

fields.description:
Rename a file so that it contains a '<' character, e.g. image<filename.jpg

Upload this file using the Drag and Drop plugin - the dialog will only the show the filename before the '<'

e.g. image

Other than that, the file seems to upload correctly.
fields.summary: Drag & Drop plugin shows incorrect file name during upload for files containing '<'
Viewxls macro causes out of memory error and then fails to render

fields.description:
Enter the URL of a page that you are restricted from viewing - example: https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/display/~mhrynczak/Checklist+-+View+Restricted


The 'View' button is shown, which in normal circumstances will display the age content for you. But, as the page is restricted, the button actually does nothing.

Showing the button, therefore, seems illogical.
fields.summary: Remove the 'View' button when a user does not have permission to view

fields.description:
It's not possible to [link an image|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/7msC] in Confluence using the RTE. 

Steps:

1. Insert Image
2. Select image
3. Insert link (as you would do with text)
4. Save 
5. Image disappears and is replaced with the link entered
fields.summary: Cannot link and image when using the Rich Text Editor

fields.description: It would be great if the new image browser had a 'paste image' feature that allowed you to add screenshots or other copied images.  Given the issue, I felt obliged to attach a screenshot.
fields.summary: Add 'paste image' option to new image browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17219].
  {panel}

We tell our customers that XML backup is unreliable because it is resource intensive.

We also tell them that only XML backup less than 2 GB is supported - this can be seen when one visits the Confluence Admin page for creating site XML backup. But there is no way for them to know how big their XML backup size is until they actually perform the backup themselves.

To allow them sufficient time to manage their data, we should create a tool to measure how large is the site or space xml backup.

This will save them and us from unnecessary pain when the XML backup size has grown too large.
fields.summary: Create a tool to gauge the size of site or space XML backup

fields.description:
Please add the ability to allow users to rate a page (or other content) using a rating system like 1 to 5 stars.  The overall rating for any individual item is the average of all ratings received.

Then, have this rating affect the order of search results such that items with ratings appear first followed by items that are not currently rated.  Of those that are rated, the 5 star items would appear first, followed by 4 star items, and so on.

We currently have a large database of technical support documents for various products in a Confluence wiki.  The ability to rate documents and have it affect search results helps customers find the more useful documents more reliably and quickly.

Thank you for your consideration of this request.
fields.summary: Allow users to rate content and have rating affect search result order

fields.description:
If you browse the Codegeist section of CAC:

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CODEGEIST/

The "Administration : Custom HTML : At end of the BODY" Google Analytics tracking code we have installed for all CAC pages is not added to the Codegeist space HTML when the {{Left Navigation Theme}} is being used.
fields.summary: Left Navigation Theme  does not include the "Custom HTML : At end of the BODY" in the output HTML

fields.description: File attached does not display in viewfile macro. Provides error message "can't convert. Create Jira"
fields.summary: viewfile macro can't convert .ppt when extension is upper case
Disable macro execution during page updates

fields.description:
Applying a v2-compliant license does not get rid of the [new license upgrade warning|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+3.0.2+Upgrade+Notes#Confluence3.0.2UpgradeNotes-NewLicenseKeyRequirementsforConfluence3.1] in the license details page.

This problem apparently affects SEN-less license only, e.g. evaluation, demonstration license. This, however, does not affect the functionality of Confluence 3.0.2.
fields.summary: Warning on new license version still appears after license upgrade to v2

fields.description:
If you were using osuser with LDAP, then your username will be stored in lowercase. 

Eg. pkamal 

However if LDAP stores your name in a different case, e.g. pKamal, then the osuser to atlassian user migration will not correctly migrate group permissions correctly (as it seems to depend on matching the case). In addition, all current permissions will fail as the permissions are recorded against the lowercase username, while the migration will store the username in the mixed case version.
fields.summary: OsUser to Atlassian User migration fails when the LDAP users have a different case to the users in the OSUSER table.
Official documentation in other languages
Update User Hover to use InlineDialog

fields.description: Must keep up with the Joneses
fields.summary: Upgrade Clickr to 2.6.

fields.description: The 'For Confluence 3.0 and above, we require that you upgrade your license key. Upgrade this license key now.' warning is still displayed after updating license with new developer license key from my.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: License warning still displayed for developer licenses after upgrading

fields.description:
Below the starred line is code that a user has on a page within Confluence.  They use the Rich text editor for their editing.  When they edit and save, the ':border=true' in {section:border=true} disappears.  This happens even if your default is set to wiki markup and you switch into the Rich text editor to see your changes.

I have replicated this bug as well.  Is there a fix for this?


*******************




h1. !SOD_Banner.jpg!
{section:border=true}{column:width=13%}
[!GOVTproductoverview.jpg!| https://wiki.thomsonreuters.com/display/GOV/CNB-LN+Product+Overview]
Look here for:

[Product Description|CNB-LN Product Overview#CNB/LN Product Description]

[Features and Benefits|CNB-LN Product Overview#CNB/LN Features and Benefits]

...

{column}
\\ {section}
fields.summary: Rich text editor changes wiki markup

fields.description:
There's an error "Unknown macro: {table}" at the top of the Example HR Page in the Demonstration Space.

.../display/ds/Example+Human+Resources+Page
fields.summary: "Example Human Resources Page" in the Demonstration Space shows "Unknown macro: {table}" at the top of the right column

fields.description:
I'm just going through updating builder's decorator code to more closely match the updates in confluence 3.x and I've noticed a lonesome, unlcosed

tag in the space.vmd at line 122.
fields.summary:
Extraneous

tag in space.vmd
